# layerCount

**Instance Property**

The number of data layers in the Aztec code symbol.

## Declaration

```swift
var layerCount: Int { get }
```

## Discussion

Combined with [doc://com.apple.coreimage/documentation/CoreImage/CIAztecCodeDescriptor/isCompact-swift.property], the number of data layers determines the number of
modules in the Aztec Code symbol. Valid values range from 1 to 32. Compact symbols can have up to 4 data layers.

The number of data layers also determines the number of bits in each data codeword of the message carried by the Aztec Code symbol.

## Examining a Descriptor

- **errorCorrectedPayload**: The error-corrected payload that comprises the the Aztec code symbol.
- **isCompact**: A Boolean value telling if the Aztec code is compact.
- **dataCodewordCount**: The number of non-error-correction codewords carried by the Aztec code symbol.
